page.title: 13Our Birds
page.content: We get lots of different kinds of birds in Dumfries and Galloway but I'm only writing about the ones around Kirkpatrick Durham and Bridge of Urr. The most common bird is the crow and I think the greater spotted woodpecker. The ones in between are the swift, wren, kestrel, buzzard, blackbird, magpie, jay, great tit, blue tit, nuthatch, tree creeper, wryneck, swallow, yellow wagtail, rook, jackdaw and kingfisher. The kestrel is a bird of prey. There are a lot of birds that are birds of prey. Here are some birds of prey: tawny owl, barn owl, buzzard and the merlin. In the birds I just mentioned the only dangerous ones are the owls, but only if you go near the nests. Some can be really tame like the sparrows, tits and wagtails.
